titleStmt.title: To SEBASTIAN SCHLESINGER,Sebastian Benzon Schlesinger; agent of Naylor Vickers in Boston; later settled in London. Close friend from 1873 of Wilkie Collins and one of his executors: see further Pilgrim Letters 12, p. 52n. and William M. Clarke, The Secret Life of Wilkie Collins, 1988. Invited to and attended the dinner (29 Feb 68) celebrating the Great Walking Match (Pilgrim Letters 12, pp. 52, 95). 8 DECEMBER 1867

dateline.placeName: Westminster Hotel, NewYork.CD had been in Boston, 19 Nov-7 Dec, arriving in New York on the evening of 7 Dec. He returned to Boston, 5 Jan 68.

body.p: Many thanks for the whiskey, and for all other tokens of your kind remembrance.Written in brown ink, the rest in blue. If I had not delivered myself up, wholly and absolutely, in bondage to the Readings, I should have had the pleasure of seeing more of you before now.
